shell.title: Introduction to AP United States History

content.instruction:
American Identity
  • What does it mean to be American?
  • How does region shape identity?

hotspots.hotspot:
Northeast

The geography of New England had a great impact on the development of those colonies.

Southeast

Nineteenth-century white Southerners took great pride in their way of life and fought the Civil War to protect it.

West

Historian Frederick Jackson Turner theorized that the American character was born from the constant pushing of the frontier.

scene.credits: (tr) VisionsofAmerica/Joe Sohm/Digital Vision/Getty Images, (c)Map Resources/Alamy, (bkgd) Comstock/PunchStock
(tr) VisionsofAmerica/Joe Sohm/Digital Vision/Getty Images, (bkgd) Comstock/PunchStock

scene.matchingInstructions: Match the items on the left to the correct areas on the right.

drops.drop: The 1920s were a time of great innovation in industry and in the arts. Analyze the impact of advances in industry and patronage of the arts on American society during this era.
To what extent had Americans developed a sense of nationalism by the War of 1812?
How did Asian Americans impact the development of the American West?

scene.instructions: When you are done, check your results by clicking 'Check Answers'.
scene.credits: (tr) VisionsofAmerica/Joe Sohm/Digital Vision/Getty Images, (bkgd) Comstock/PunchStock
(tr) VisionsofAmerica/Joe Sohm/Digital Vision/Getty Images, (bkgd) Comstock/PunchStock
(tr) VisionsofAmerica/Joe Sohm/Digital Vision/Getty Images, (bkgd) Comstock/PunchStock

(tr) VisionsofAmerica/Joe Sohm/Digital Vision/Getty Images, (c)Thomas Cole, 1801-1848. River in the Catskills, 1843. Oil on canvas. Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. Gift of Martha C. Karolik for the M. and M. Karolik Collection of American Paintings, 1815-1865 47.1201. Photograph Â© 2012 Museum of Fine Arts, Boston., (bkgd) Comstock/PunchStock

scene.matchingInstructions: Match the items on the left to the correct areas on the right.

drops.drop: Analyze the impact of laissez-faire government policies on the growth of U.S. industry at the turn of the 20th century.
Major industrial disasters have negatively impacted the United States since 1980. Identify at least two of these events, and discuss their impact on U.S. domestic policies.
Discuss the relationship between "New Immigrants" and urban Americans in regards to their political, economic, and cultural impact on American society.

scene.instructions: When you are done, check your results by clicking 'Check Answers'.

multiple.question: Which of the following best connects with the ideals of the Framers of the Constitution?

hotspots.hotspot:
Beliefs and Practices

Americans have followed many faiths and incorporated religion into their lives in many ways.

Life and Society

Religious reformers have sought to improve society.

multiple.question: Which themes are most likely covered in a section featuring this image of New York City in 1908?

answers.answer: Slavery and Its Legacies and Globalization

multiple.question: Which themes are most likely covered in a section featuring this graph showing labor union membership?

answers.answer: Slavery and Its Legacies and American Diversity

scene.instruction: Answer each question by selecting "True" or "False."

multiple.question: A theme is a dominant or unifying idea that helps show connections over time throughout history.
Considering AP U.S. History themes helps show connections among events.
Your teacher will probably expect you to name and give information about each AP U.S. History theme as part of your course.
Using AP U.S. History themes to organize your notes will help you prepare for success on the AP exam.
The rights of migrant farm workers are an example of the theme: American Identity.

scene.credits: (tr) VisionsofAmerica/Joe Sohm/Digital Vision/Getty Images, (bkgd) Comstock/PunchStock
